predicted_summary.wugNATSS-led(on-simp): Directs the Secretary of State to establish a commission on programs and policies for combatting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.Directs the Commission to conduct a thorough study of the organization, policies, and programs of the U.S. government related to combatting the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.Directs the National Security Agency (NIA) to establish a Joint Arms Control and Biological Weapons Prevention and Mitigation Commission to develop recommendations on improving the effectiveness of the organization, policies, programs of the Intelligence Community, and the programs and policies of the other departments and agencies of the federal government in meeting the national security interests of the United States with respect to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.Directs the Commission to use the United States Mail in the same manner and under the same conditions as other departments and agencies of the Federal government.Directs the Chairman of the Commission to: (1) fix the compensation of the Executive Director and other personnel without regard to the provisions of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA), which require the chairman to procure temporary and intermittent services at rates which do not exceed the daily equivalent of the basic pay prescribed for the Executive Schedule; predicted_summary.wugNATSS-led(on-simp): Rural Electrification Act of 1936 - Amends the Federal Emergency Management Act of 1937 to require the elimination of an eligible rural community if: (1) it is not in the urbanized area contiguous and adjacent to such a city, town, or village; (2) the average median household income is not more than 80 percent of the national average median income; and (3) it has no established business or professional relationship with the city or town or the borough or village.Requires the Secretary to take steps necessary to reduce the paperwork required of applicants.Amends the Rural Electification Act of 1936 to prohibit the secreary from approving a loan or loan guarantee for the provision of new broadband service to an eligible rural community.Amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to extend the useful life of the assets constructed, improved, or acquired with the proceeds of the loan or extension of credit.Directs the Secretary to report to Congress on the status of the program.
predicted_summary.wugwATSS-led(on-simp): Amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to: (1) make eligible rural communities in the urbanized area contiguous and adjacent to such a city, town, or village eligible for electrification; and (2) require the rural community to have at least 20% of the median household income of the residents of such a community.Sets forth equity requirements for applications submitted to the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) in areas in which at least 40 percent of the population does not have access to broadband service, unless the value of the assets of the applicant not pledged or hypothecated for any other purpose is more than $1 million.Amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to: (1) require the securitization of certain transmission lines in rural areas to be made available for the provision of new broadband service to 3 or more rural communities; and (2) require certain amounts of such transmission line ownership to be available for entities with various shares of installed telephone subscriber lines.Amends the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Act to extend the useful life of certain rural electrification assets acquired with the proceeds of the loan or extension of credit to "35 years".Directs the Secretary to: (1) report to Congress on the status of the program; and (2) make available to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the House and the Senate a report on the program status.
